places.name: Saxony
places.description: A state in eastern Germany.

places.name: Sicily
places.description: Sicily is the largest and most populous island in the Mediterranean Sea and one of the twenty regions of Italy.

places.name: Andes
places.description: Mountain range in western South America.

places.name: Solfatara Caldera
places.description: Solfatara di Pozzuoli is a volcanic crater near Naples. Though a dormant volcano, it emits jets of steam and sulphurous fumes.

places.name: Mount Vesuvius
places.description: Mount Vesuvius is a somma-stratovolcano located on the Gulf of Naples in Campania, Italy.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

places.name: Northumberland
places.description: County in the North East of England. It borders Scotland to the north and the county of Cumbria to the west.

places.name: Dorset
places.description: A county in southwest England. It’s known for the Jurassic Coast, a long stretch on the English Channel where the cliffs contain many fossils, and rock formations show millions of years of geological history.

works.name: Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London
works.author: John Stephens

persons.name: JohnWilliams
persons.description: The son of a Welsh miner, Williams was a mining engineer with forty years' experience. He worked in various locations in Scotland; in 1789 published The Natural History of the Mineral Kingdom. Died in Italy where he was carrying out further researches.

places.name: Dysart
places.description: Scottish town in Fife. Historically, its ports enabled trading with the Low Countries; the area mined and exported salt and coal.

works.name: The Natural History of the Mineral Kingdom in Three Parts
works.author: John Williams

places.name: Altofts
places.description: Village located five miles from the centre of Wakefield, West Yorkshire, UK.

places.name: Birkwood Common
places.description: Located in Normanton, Yorkshire, in the UK. Birkwood Common was thought to be the location of an archeological henge; this has since been reassessed as surface remnants of nearby shallow coal mining.

persons.name: WilliamHamilton
persons.description: English diplomat, politician, antiquarian, and vulcanologist who served as the Envoy Extraordinary to the Kingdom of Naples from 1764 to 1800. FRSL.

places.name: Mount Etna
places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

places.description: Mount Etna, or simply Etna, is an active stratovolcano on the east coast of Sicily, Italy.

places.name: Coalbrookdale
places.description: Town located in the Ironbridge Gorge, Shropshire, UK. Famous for its history of iron ore smelting.

places.name: Shropshire
places.description: A county in the West Midlands of England.

places.name: Stromboli
places.description: an island in the Tyrrhenian Sea, off the north coast of Sicily, containing Mount Stromboli, one of the four active volcanoes in Italy. It is one of the seven Aeolian Islands, a volcanic arc north of Sicily.

places.name: Lipari
places.description: A commune including six of seven islands of the Aeolian Islands located in the Tyrrhenian Sea off the northern coast of Sicily in southern Italy.

places.name: Stromboli
places.description: an island in the Tyrrhenian Sea, off the north coast of Sicily, containing Mount Stromboli, one of the four active volcanoes in Italy. It is one of the seven Aeolian Islands, a volcanic arc north of Sicily.

persons.name: LuigiGalvani
persons.description: Italian surgeon and anatomist who carried out experiments with electricity and animals. The term 'galvanism' was named after him

persons.name: LuigiGalvani
persons.description: Italian surgeon and anatomist who carried out experiments with electricity and animals. The term 'galvanism' was named after him

persons.name: Déodat Gratet deDolomieu
persons.description: French geologist. The rock, and region of the Alps, dolomite was named after him.

persons.name: JamesHall
persons.description: Scottish baronet (1776) and MP. Chemist and geologist who supported of James Hutton's theories of uniformitarian geology. FRSL.

persons.name: GregoryWatt
persons.description: Youngest son of James Watt. Lodged with Davy's mother in Penzance during the winter of 1797-8 and became close friends with Davy.

places.name: Cornwall
places.description: Cornwall is a county in south-west England, birthplace of Humphry Davy.

places.description: A county in southwest England. It’s known for the Jurassic Coast, a long stretch on the English Channel where the cliffs contain many fossils, and rock formations show millions of years of geological history.

places.name: Devon
places.description: A county in south-west England.

places.name: Wiltshire
places.description: A county in south-western England. The county town is Trowbridge.

places.name: Derbyshire
places.description: Derbyshire is a county in the East Midlands and includes part of the Peak District.

places.name: Darling Downs
places.description: The South Downs are a range of chalk hills extending from Hampshire to Sussex.

places.name: Antilles
places.description: An archipelago bordered by the Caribbean Sea to the south and west, the Gulf of Mexico to the northwest, and the Atlantic Ocean to the north and east.

places.name: Pacific Ocean
places.description: The largest and deepest of Earth's five oceans.
